Document details
'You are my wife. I am your husband. Therefore, out of my love, affection and affection for you, and in order to make your life better, I consider that love as a reward, and I have built a R.C.C. Daba house with my own money in the Scheduled Property acquired by our ancestors and subsequently inherited by them through their inheritance, and I am enjoying the full possession of the Scheduled Property with the right to donate and sell it, with the full right of possession, free of charge, and free of charge, for the amount of Rs. 2,97,000/- in words, two lakh ninety-seven thousand rupees, and I have made it your possession today. Therefore, you shall be the sole owner of the Scheduled Property and shall pay the Gram Panchayat taxes, etc., and shall have your name registered in the Gram Panchayat records and enjoy all the rights of the sale of the property with your descendants. In this regard, I, your heirs and my heirs, will never have any disputes or disputes. I will settle all disputes and disputes arising from any cause regarding the Scheduled Property at my own expense and make your property permanent for you. I have filed the transfer forms along with this. I have not made any alienation or alienation of the Scheduled Property. I hereby certify to you that there are no outstanding debts, bank loans, etc. or any court proceedings, etc. on this property as of today. If there are any such debts or debts, I will pay and settle them all without any dispute with you. No one else has any right or authority over this property except me. You have all the rights to get bank loans, etc. on the Scheduled Property. This is a settlement deed of acquisition of immovable property registered in Darishi village by my consent.
Declaration
1) This property is not an assignment property prohibited under Act 9/77. 2) The property as per Schedule is not mortgaged to the Government or its agencies. In case of any other claim, I shall be liable to the action taken by the Department under Sections 27 and 64 of the Indian Stamp Act. I hereby acknowledge that I shall be liable to the action taken by the Department against me and to pay the depreciation tax if any such material fact is found to have been concealed in this document. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 747 of 2026, dated 27/Jan/2026, executed by Dola Pedda Venkateswarlu. in favour of his Wife, Dola Ankamma, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 106.666 Sq.Yds, bearing house number 3-28, Assessment No. 228, comprised in survey number 36, situated in Bhumanapalli Village and Gram Panchayat, Donakonda Mandal, within the District of Prakasam, registered at sub-registrar office Darsi, is bounded as follows: North by: House of Dola Chinna Venkateswarlu South by: Rakapokala Cement Road East by: Rakapokala Cement Road West by: House of Dola Chennaiah

It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or
Lease Deed

Note : It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
